about.name: Barcelona
about.info_text: Barcelona is a vibrant and cosmopolitan city located on the northeastern coast of the Iberian Peninsula in Spain. It is the capital of the Catalonia region and is known for its rich history, stunning architecture, beautiful beaches, and a lively arts and culture scene. Barcelona is famous for its unique blend of Gothic and modernist architecture, with landmarks like the Sagrada Família and Park Güell designed by Antoni Gaudí. Visitors can explore the city's historic neighborhoods, enjoy delicious Catalan cuisine, and relax on the Mediterranean shores. Whether you're interested in history, art, or simply savoring the Mediterranean lifestyle, Barcelona has something to offer everyone.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 1.6 million
Autonomous Community: Catalonia
Time Zone: Central European Time (CET, UTC+01:00)
Language: Catalan, Spanish
Currency: Euro (EUR)
about.climate_text: Barcelona has a Mediterranean climate with mild, wet winters and hot, dry summers. The average temperature ranges from 8°C (46°F) in winter to 30°C (86°F) in summer, making it a great year-round destination for travelers.

attractions_card.title: Sagrada Família
attractions_card.description: The Sagrada Família is a renowned basilica and an iconic symbol of Barcelona, known for its intricate architecture and ongoing construction.

attractions_card.title: Park Güell
attractions_card.description: Park Güell is a colorful public park designed by Antoni Gaudí, featuring whimsical mosaics, sculptures, and stunning city views.

attractions_card.title: La Rambla
attractions_card.description: La Rambla is a famous boulevard in the heart of the city, known for its vibrant street life, shops, and lively atmosphere.

attractions_card.title: Casa Batlló
attractions_card.description: Casa Batlló is a modernist building designed by Gaudí, featuring a unique architectural style and open for guided tours.

attractions_card.title: Barri Gòtic (Gothic Quarter)
attractions_card.description: The Gothic Quarter is the historic center of Barcelona, with narrow streets, medieval buildings, and historic sites like the Barcelona Cathedral.

attractions_card.title: Magic Fountain of Montjuïc
attractions_card.description: The Magic Fountain is a spectacular fountain with nightly light and music shows, located in the Montjuïc neighborhood.

attractions_card.title: Casa Milà (La Pedrera)
attractions_card.description: Casa Milà, also known as La Pedrera, is another Gaudí masterpiece, known for its unique design and rooftop terrace.

attractions_card.title: Barcelona Beaches
attractions_card.description: Barcelona offers several beautiful beaches along its coastline, including Barceloneta Beach, perfect for sunbathing and water sports.

food_card.title: Tapas
food_card.description: Tapas are a popular Spanish dining tradition, and Barcelona offers a wide variety of small plates, including patatas bravas, croquettes, and more.

food_card.title: Paella
food_card.description: Paella is a classic Spanish dish, and you can savor seafood or Valencian paella in many Barcelona restaurants.

food_card.title: Crema Catalana
food_card.description: Crema Catalana is a delicious dessert similar to crème brûlée, with a caramelized sugar top and creamy custard inside.

food_card.title: Cava
food_card.description: Cava is a Spanish sparkling wine that originates from Catalonia, and you can enjoy it in local bars and restaurants.

food_card.title: Churros with Chocolate
food_card.description: Churros are a popular Spanish treat, and they are often enjoyed with a cup of rich, melted chocolate for dipping.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Arts Barcelona
hotels_card.description: Hotel Arts Barcelona offers luxurious accommodations, a beachfront location, and stunning views of the Mediterranean Sea.

hotels_card.title: Majestic Hotel & Spa Barcelona
hotels_card.description: The Majestic Hotel & Spa is a historic and elegant hotel, known for its top-notch service and rooftop bar.

hotels_card.title: W Barcelona
hotels_card.description: W Barcelona, also known as the Hotel Vela, is a modern beachfront hotel offering contemporary design and panoramic sea views.

hotels_card.title: Cotton House Hotel
hotels_card.description: Cotton House Hotel is a charming boutique hotel with a cozy atmosphere, located in a neoclassical building.

hotels_card.title: H10 Casa Mimosa
hotels_card.description: H10 Casa Mimosa is a stylish hotel set in a modernist building, offering comfortable rooms and a terrace with city views.

transport_card.title: Barcelona-El Prat Airport
transport_card.description: Barcelona-El Prat Airport (BCN) is the main international airport serving Barcelona, located about 12 kilometers from the city center.

transport_card.title: Barcelona Metro
transport_card.description: The Barcelona Metro is an efficient way to navigate the city, with various lines connecting key attractions and neighborhoods.

transport_card.title: Bus and Tram
transport_card.description: Barcelona has an extensive bus and tram network, providing convenient transportation within the city and its outskirts.

transport_card.title: Bicing (Bike Share)
transport_card.description: Bicing is Barcelona's bike-sharing system, offering an eco-friendly way to explore the city at your own pace.
